page.title: 13Village Life,The Blacksmith
page.content: There has been a Blacksmith on this site since the 1870's.The present business has been here 35 years, the blacksmith now working alone since his father retired. The building is original and remains unchanged,apart from there being only 1 hearth (was 2) which now has an electric blower-but the large bellows can still be seen hanging from the ceiling. Agriculltural repairs (Straightening bent and mending broken equipment) are the biggest part of his work during summer months.He makes firebaskets and firedogs,gates weather vanes, brackets and other ornamental work in the winter months for sale during the year.He often makes implements to order such as a buck rake and bag lifter.
